reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. Her expectations about her European backpacking trip were really high. She had been looking forward to the trip for a year. She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. As she stood in line, she could feel those experiences were finally so close. When she approached the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. Maya reached into her pocket but felt nothing. She realized she had left her passport at home. Her plans were ruined. She was heartbroken, knowing she could not board the flight and had to delay her dream trip.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 목적으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: to describe a moment of sudden disappointment
to provide travel tips for a trip to Europe
to complain about an unhelpful airline employee
to advertise popular tourist attractions in Paris

answer.explanation: 이 글은 오랫동안 고대해 온 유럽 여행에 대한 높은 기대감을 가지고 공항에 간 Maya가 여권을 집에 두고 온 사실을 깨닫고 좌절하는 순간을 서술하고 있습니다. 글의 전반적인 내용은 기대감이 절망감으로 바뀌는 개인적인 경험을 묘사하는 것이므로, '갑작스러운 실망의 순간을 묘사하기 위해'가 가장 적절한 목적입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. Her expectations about her European backpacking trip were really high. She had been looking forward to the trip for a year. She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. As she stood in line, she could feel those experiences were finally so close. When she approached the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. Maya reached into her pocket but felt nothing. She realized she had left her passport at home. Her plans were ruined. She was heartbroken, knowing she could not board the flight and had to delay her dream trip.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 제목으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: A Dream Trip Postponed by a Mistake
The Beauty of Paris at Night
How to Pack for a Backpacking Trip

answer.explanation: 이 글은 Maya가 1년 동안 기대했던 꿈의 여행이 여권을 잊어버리는 '실수(a Mistake)' 때문에 '연기되어야(postponed)' 하는 상황을 이야기하고 있습니다. 따라서 '실수로 인해 연기된 꿈의 여행'이 이 글의 핵심 내용을 가장 잘 요약하는 제목입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. Her expectations about her European backpacking trip were really high. She had been looking forward to the trip for a year. She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. As she stood in line, she could feel those experiences were finally so close. When she approached the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. Maya reached into her pocket but felt nothing. She realized she had left her passport at home. Her plans were ruined. She was heartbroken, knowing she could not board the flight and had to delay her dream trip.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 요지로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: Maya's dream of a European trip was abruptly shattered when she realized she forgot her passport at home.
Travelers should always arrive at the airport several hours before their flight to avoid any unexpected delays.
European museums and landmarks require visitors to present valid identification before they are allowed to enter.
Careful and thorough preparation is the most important factor for ensuring a successful overseas backpacking adventure.
Airline employees are trained to handle difficult situations with professionalism and empathy towards their customers.

answer.explanation: 이 글은 Maya의 높은 기대감으로 시작하여, 체크인 카운터에서 여권이 없다는 사실을 깨닫고 계획이 망가지고 상심하는 것으로 끝납니다. 글의 핵심은 오랫동안 기다려온 여행이 여권을 잊는 결정적인 실수 하나로 갑작스럽게 무산되었다는 점입니다. 따라서 'Maya의 유럽 여행이라는 꿈은 그녀가 여권을 집에 두고 온 것을 깨달았을 때 갑작스럽게 산산조각 났다.'가 글의 요지입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. Her expectations about her European backpacking trip were really high. She had been looking forward to the trip for a year. She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. As she stood in line, she could feel those experiences were finally so close. When she approached the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. ( ① ) She realized she had left her passport at home. ( ② ) Her plans were ruined. ( ③ ) She was heartbroken, knowing she could not board the flight and had to delay her dream trip. ( ④ )
reading_comprehension_problems.question:
글의 흐름으로 보아, 주어진 문장이 들어가기에 가장 적절한 곳은?

**Maya reached into her pocket but felt nothing.**

answer.explanation: 주어진 문장은 'Maya는 주머니에 손을 넣었지만 아무것도 느끼지 못했다.'는 의미입니다. 이 행동은 바로 앞 문장에서 항공사 직원이 여권을 보여달라고 요청한 것에 대한 직접적인 반응입니다. 그리고 이 행동의 결과로, 다음 문장에서 그녀는 여권을 집에 두고 온 것을 '깨닫게(realized)' 됩니다. 따라서 주어진 문장은 직원의 요청과 Maya의 깨달음 사이인 ①에 위치하는 것이 논리적으로 가장 자연스럽습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. Her expectations about her European backpacking trip were really high.

question_blocks.A: When she approached the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. Maya reached into her pocket but felt nothing.
question_blocks.B: She had been looking forward to the trip for a year. She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. As she stood in line, she could feel those experiences were finally so close.
question_blocks.C: She realized she had left her passport at home. Her plans were ruined. She was heartbroken, knowing she could not board the flight and had to delay her dream trip.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 주어진 글 다음에 이어질 글의 순서로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: 주어진 글은 Maya가 비행기 탑승 수속을 위해 줄을 서 있고 기대감이 매우 높다는 내용입니다. (B)는 그 높은 기대감에 대해 1년 동안 고대해왔고 마드리드와 파리에서 할 일들을 상상하며 느꼈던 감정을 구체적으로 설명하며 내용을 이어갑니다. (A)는 줄을 서 있다가 마침내 카운터에 도착하여 여권을 요청받고 주머니를 확인하는 사건의 전환점을 보여줍니다. (C)는 주머니를 확인한 결과 여권이 없다는 것을 깨닫고 좌절하는 결말을 서술합니다. 따라서 기대감의 구체화 (B) -> 사건의 발생 (A) -> 결과 및 좌절 (C)의 순서가 가장 자연스럽습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. Her expectations about her European backpacking trip were really high. She had been looking forward to the trip for a year. She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. As she stood in line, she could feel those experiences were finally so close. When she approached the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. Maya reached into her pocket but felt nothing. She realized she had left her passport at home. Her plans were ruined. She was heartbroken, knowing she could not board the flight and had to _______________.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 빈칸에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: 글의 마지막 부분은 Maya가 여권이 없어서 비행기에 탑승할 수 없다는 사실을 알고 상심했다는 내용입니다. 여권 없이는 국제선 비행기에 탑승할 수 없으므로, 그녀가 1년 동안 고대했던 '꿈의 여행(dream trip)'은 미뤄질 수밖에 없는 상황입니다. 따라서 빈칸에는 '그녀의 꿈의 여행을 미뤄야만 했다'는 의미의 'delay her dream trip'이 들어가는 것이 가장 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. Her expectations about her European backpacking trip were really ① `high`. She had been looking forward to the trip for a year. She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. As she stood in line, she could feel those experiences were finally so ② `close`. When she approached the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. Maya reached into her pocket but felt nothing. She realized she had left her passport at home. Her plans were ③ `confirmed`. She was ④ `heartbroken`, knowing she could not board the flight and had to ⑤ `delay` her dream trip.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 문맥상 낱말의 쓰임이 적절하지 않은 것은?

answer.explanation: Maya가 공항에서 여권을 집에 두고 온 사실을 깨달은 상황입니다. 이로 인해 그녀의 여행 계획은 무산되었습니다. ③번의 'confirmed'(확정되었다)는 계획이 예정대로 진행됨을 의미하므로, '망가졌다(ruined)'는 전체적인 글의 흐름과 정반대되는 의미를 가집니다. 따라서 'confirmed'는 문맥상 적절하지 않습니다. ① high(높은), ② close(가까운), ④ heartbroken(상심한), ⑤ delay(미루다)는 모두 문맥에 맞게 사용되었습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. Her (A) `expectations` about her European backpacking trip were really high. She had been looking forward to the trip for a year. She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. As she stood in line, she could feel those experiences were finally so close. When she (B) `approached` the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. Maya reached into her pocket but felt nothing. She (C) `realized` she had left her passport at home. Her plans were (D) `ruined`. She was heartbroken, knowing she could not board the flight and had to (E) `delay` her dream trip.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 밑줄 친 (A)~(E)에 대한 영영 풀이가 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: (A) expectations: beliefs about what will happen in the future
(B) approached: to come near to someone or something in distance
(C) realized: to understand a situation, sometimes suddenly
(D) ruined: to spoil or destroy something completely
(E) delay: to arrange for an event to happen at an earlier time

answer.explanation: (E) 'delay'는 '미루다, 지연시키다'라는 의미입니다. 하지만 보기 ⑤의 영영 풀이는 '어떤 일이 더 이른 시간에 일어나도록 준비하다(to arrange for an event to happen at an earlier time)'로, 이는 'delay'의 반대 의미(앞당기다)에 해당합니다. 따라서 이 영영 풀이는 적절하지 않습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. Her expectations about her European backpacking trip were really (A) [high / low]. She had been looking forward to the trip for a year. She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. As she stood in line, she could feel those experiences were finally so close. When she approached the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. Maya reached into her pocket but felt (B) [nothing / something]. She realized she had left her passport at home. Her plans were (C) [ruined / saved]. She was heartbroken, knowing she could not board the flight and had to delay her dream trip.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 문맥에 맞는 낱말로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: (A) Maya는 1년 동안 여행을 고대해왔으므로 기대감이 '높았다(high)'고 하는 것이 자연스럽습니다. (B) 여권을 찾기 위해 주머니에 손을 넣었지만 찾지 못했으므로 '아무것도 느끼지 못했다(felt nothing)'가 문맥에 맞습니다. (C) 여권이 없어서 비행기를 탈 수 없게 되었으므로 그녀의 계획은 '망가졌다(ruined)'고 해야 합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. Her expectations about her European backpacking trip were really high. She had been looking forward to the trip for a year. ① She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. ② As she stood in line, she could feel those experiences were finally so close. ③ The airport had recently upgraded its security systems for international flights. ④ When she approached the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. ⑤ Maya reached into her pocket but felt nothing.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글에서 전체 흐름과 관계 없는 문장은?

answer.explanation: 이 글은 Maya라는 개인의 여행에 대한 기대감과 그것이 좌절되는 과정을 서술하는 개인적인 이야기입니다. ①, ②, ④, ⑤는 모두 Maya의 생각, 감정, 행동과 직접적으로 연결되어 이야기의 흐름을 이어갑니다. 하지만 ③번 문장 '그 공항은 최근 국제선을 위한 보안 시스템을 업그레이드했다.'는 공항의 일반적인 사실을 설명할 뿐, Maya의 개인적인 이야기와는 직접적인 관련이 없어 전체 흐름에서 벗어납니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Maya waited in line to check in for her flight. ① She [had been looking / has been looking] forward to the trip for a year. She couldn't wait to visit museums in Madrid and see the Eiffel Tower at night in Paris. As she stood in line, she could feel ② [that / what] those experiences were finally so close. When she approached the counter, the airline employee asked to see her passport. Maya reached into her pocket but felt nothing. She realized she had left her passport at home. Her plans were ruined. She was heartbroken, ③ [knowing / known] she could not board the flight and had to delay her dream trip.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 어법에 맞는 표현으로 가장 적절한 것을 각각 고르시오.

answer.explanation: 글의 주된 시제가 'waited', 'were' 등 과거입니다. 그녀가 공항에서 줄을 서 있던 과거 시점보다 더 이전에 시작되어 그 시점까지 계속된 행동을 나타내므로, 과거완료진행형인 'had been looking'이 적절합니다. 현재완료진행형 'has been looking'은 현재와 관련된 동작을 나타낼 때 씁니다.
'feel'의 목적어로 쓰이는 명사절을 이끌어야 합니다. 뒷부분 'those experiences were finally so close'가 주어, 동사, 보어를 모두 갖춘 완전한 절이므로, 접속사 'that'이 와야 합니다. 관계대명사 'what'은 뒤에 불완전한 절을 이끕니다.
분사구문 자리로, 주절의 주어인 'She'(Maya)가 '아는' 능동적인 주체이므로 현재분사인 'knowing'이 맞습니다. 'known'은 수동의 의미를 가지므로 어색합니다. 이 분사구문은 'as she knew' 또는 'because she knew'의 의미를 가집니다.
